verses.text: 這事以後，大衛求問耶和華說：「我可以上猶大的一座城去嗎？」耶和華回答：「你上去吧。」大衛又問：「我應該上到哪裡去呢？」他回答：「上希伯崙去！」

words.note: 座 is a measure word for large, fixed objects like mountains or buildings.

verses.text: 於是大衛帶著他的兩個妻子，一個是耶斯列人亞希暖，一個是作過迦密人拿八妻子的亞比該，上到那裡去了。
大衛也把與他在一起的人，和他們各人的家眷都帶上去。他們就在希伯崙的城鎮裡住下來。

words.note: Introduces object of a verb, indicating it is disposed of or acted upon.
Forms a modifying phrase into a nominal group.
Used as a resultative complement, indicating stabilization or settling.

verses.text: 於是猶大人來到希伯崙，在那裡膏立了大衛作王，統治猶大家。有人報告大衛說：「埋葬掃羅的是基列．雅比人。」

words.note: Lit. 'anoint and establish'
Implies an indefinite 'someone' or 'there was'.
Indicates the preceding clause is the subject or modifier.

verses.text: 大衛就差派使者到基列．雅比人那裡去，對他們說：「願耶和華賜福給你們，因為你們厚待了你們的主掃羅，把他埋葬了。

words.note: Lit. 'bestow blessing'
Introduces object of a verb, indicating it is disposed of or acted upon.

verses.text: 你們既作了這事，現在就願耶和華以慈愛和誠實待你們，我也要善待你們。

words.note: A key biblical concept.
Often paired with 慈愛 (lovingkindness and truth) in Scripture.

verses.text: 現在你們要堅強，要作勇敢的人，因為你們的主掃羅已經死了；猶大家已經膏立了我作他們的王了。」

words.note: Refers to the tribe or kingdom of Judah.
A specific action for setting someone apart as king/priest.

verses.text: 當時，掃羅的元帥尼珥的兒子押尼珥已經領著掃羅的兒子伊施波設，把他帶過河到瑪哈念去，
verses.heading: David’s Army Clashes with the Army of Saul

verses.text: 並且立了他作王，統治基列、亞書利、耶斯列、以法蓮、便雅憫和以色列眾人。

words.note: Refers to a people or region related to Asher.
Here refers to the people/kingdom of Israel.

verses.text: 掃羅的兒子伊施波設作以色列王的時候，已經四十歲；他作王共兩年。猶大家卻追隨大衛。

words.note: Refers to the tribe or kingdom of Judah.

verses.text: 大衛在希伯崙作王統治猶大家的時候共有七年零六個月。

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'to be king'
Used to connect whole numbers and fractions/smaller units.

verses.text: 尼珥的兒子押尼珥帶著掃羅的兒子伊施波設的僕從，離開瑪哈念，到基遍去。

words.definition: to arrive at, to go to

verses.text: 洗魯雅的兒子約押和大衛的臣僕也出來，在基遍的水池旁邊與他們會面。大家都坐下，一隊在水池這邊，一隊在水池那邊。

words.note: Refers to loyal subjects or servants of a ruler.
More formal than '跟'.

words.definition: to meet, to have an audience

words.note: Lit. 'big family', meaning 'everybody'.

verses.text: 押尼珥對約押說：「讓年輕人起來，在我們面前比比武。」約押說：「好！叫他們起來。」

words.definition: to rise up, to get up
to have a contest of arms
words.note: Reduplication of '比武' (to compete in martial arts) for a softer tone.

words.definition: to rise up, to get up

verses.text: 他們就起來，按著人數走過去：屬便雅憫，就是屬掃羅的兒子伊施波設的，有十二人；屬大衛臣僕的也有十二人。

words.definition: to rise up, to get up
to walk over, to pass by
to belong to, to be subordinate to

words.note: Refers to the tribe of Benjamin.
Here indicates 'those belonging to'.
Here indicates 'those belonging to'.

verses.text: 他們各人都緊緊抓住對手的頭，用刀刺進對手的肋旁，於是他們全都倒斃。所以在基遍那地方就叫作希利甲．哈素林。

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes the degree.
Refers to the anatomical side of the body.
A somewhat archaic or formal term for dying, common in biblical texts.

verses.text: 那天的戰事非常激烈，結果押尼珥和以色列人敗在大衛的臣僕面前。

words.note: Lit. 'not common', meaning extraordinary.
Comprises 'Israel' (a transliterated name) and 'people'.

verses.text: 洗魯雅的三個兒子約押、亞比篩和亞撒黑都在那裡。亞撒黑的腿輕快如野地的羚羊一般。

words.note: Used to denote similarity, 'like a...'

verses.text: 亞撒黑追趕押尼珥，緊緊地跟著他，不偏左，也不偏右。

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes the degree.

verses.text: 押尼珥往後瞧著，說：「你是亞撒黑嗎？」他回答：「我正是。」
押尼珥對他說：「你或轉左或轉右，抓住一個年輕人，奪去他的武器吧！」可是亞撒黑不願意離開不追趕他。

words.note: Indicates suggestion or mild command.

verses.text: 押尼珥再一次對亞撒黑說：「你離開，別追趕我！我為甚麼要把你砍倒在地上呢？以後怎麼還有臉見你的哥哥約押呢？」

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.
Refers to having dignity, courage, or respect.

verses.text: 亞撒黑不肯離開，所以押尼珥就用槍的尾端刺入了他的肚子，槍從他的背後穿出。亞撒黑仆倒在那裡，當場死了。所有來到亞撒黑倒斃的地方的人，都站住不動。

words.note: Often used in biblical or classical texts for falling prostrate.
A formal or classical term for dying, often violently.

verses.text: 約押和亞比篩卻繼續追趕押尼珥。日落的時候，他們來到亞瑪山，就在通往基遍曠野的路旁，基亞的對面。
便雅憫人集結在押尼珥後面，站在一座山頭上，列成一個隊伍。
押尼珥對約押喊叫，說：「刀劍要不停地殺人嗎？你不知道結局是痛苦的嗎？你要等到甚麼時候才吩咐人民轉去，不追趕自己的兄弟呢？」

words.note: Refers to a weapon, often symbolic in biblical context.
Forms an adjective/adverb into a noun phrase, 'that which is painful'.

verses.text: 約押說：「我指著永活的 神起誓，如果你們沒有說過比武的話，大家必在早晨的時候離去，不再追趕自己的兄弟。」

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts, especially for God.
A common typesetting convention in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
When capitalized in English, refers to the monotheistic God.
Refers to a combat challenge or contest.
Stronger than '會' (will), implying inevitability.

verses.text: 於是約押吹響號角，眾人就站住，不再追趕以色列人，也不再打仗了。
押尼珥和屬他的人，整夜走過亞拉巴，渡過約旦河，又走過畢倫，才回到瑪哈念。
約押追趕押尼珥回來，集合所有人的時候，發現在大衛的臣僕中，除了亞撒黑以外，還少了十九個人。

words.note: Used to connect a descriptive clause to '時候' (time).
Refers to officials or loyal servants, especially in a royal court.

verses.text: 但大衛的臣僕擊殺便雅憫人和跟隨押尼珥的人，共有三百六十人死了。

words.note: Refers to officials or loyal followers.
Functions as a measure word after a number.
Indicates completion of an action.

verses.text: 他們把亞撒黑抬回去，埋葬在伯利恆他父親的墳墓裡。約押和屬他的人走了一整夜，天亮的時候才回到希伯崙。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb.
Directional complement indicating movement away from the speaker/narrator's current location.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Used to emphasize the entirety of something.
Forms a noun phrase with the preceding verb or phrase.
Often combined with '的' to mean 'when'.
Serves as a resultative complement indicating arrival.
